title: Hou'se My Area
description:
A website to help people look at places to live by comparing crime rates, school locations, house prices etc.
Crime data is displayed real-time (to the closest month).

shortDescriptions.title: The goal
shortDescriptions.description: Use at least 3 datasets on the internet and create a prototype for a chosen audience.

title: Crochet
description: I started doing crochet back in high school, when I was around 10 years old. My projects range from toys to furniture repair.

shortDescriptions.title: Fun fact
shortDescriptions.description: Every year, I fall out and back in love with crochet. It's a love/hate relationship.

title: Camel Carry
description:
A game made alongside another student.
Camel carry is a puzzle game loosely similar to river crossing problems, where the player must transport items using their camel in the time limit, with different restrictions.
The camel was rigged and animated by me.

shortDescriptions.title: The goal
shortDescriptions.description: Create an engaging game involving an interactive tutorial.

title: Out with the old... In with the new (Musicians of Brehmen)
description:
A game made alongside another student.
This game was a labour of love! It features a branching story engine with multiple endings and different scenarios. The game is based on the tale 'Musicians of Brehmen'

shortDescriptions.title: The goal
shortDescriptions.description: Create an engaging game involving a story engine.

title: Dungeon Run 52
description:
A game made alongside another student.
A procedurally generated rogue-like dungeon crawler. The game is never-ending, however the difficulty ends after 5 levels, as proof of concept.

shortDescriptions.title: The goal
shortDescriptions.description: Create an engaging game involving new technology.

title: Lithuanian Language Learning App
description:
For my 3rd year project, I created a single page application providing a crash-course introduction to the Lithuanian language.
To test it, I performed tests with human participants and assessed their Lithuanian knowledge before and after using the app.

shortDescriptions.title: The goal
shortDescriptions.description: Prove that the Lithuanian language can be taught with an online tool.

title: Data Visualisation and Analaysis
description:
This page was created to solve an issue using data. The issue chosen was - 'Are EU Immigrants Harming the People of the UK?'
The project uses real datasets and utilises interactive charts to include the reader and to draw conclusions with the author.

shortDescriptions.title: Technologies used
shortDescriptions.description: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, D3.js, dc.js, Tableau

title: Power Plants of the World - Visualisation
description:
This project was part of a coursework.
The project is presented in terms of an interactive page/report.

shortDescriptions.title: The goal
shortDescriptions.description: to clean a (very) messy dataset, extract important information from it and to apply it in creating a visualisation.

shortDescriptions.title: Technologies used
shortDescriptions.description: HTML, JavaScript,CSS, D3.js, OpenRefine, Microsoft Excel

title: About Me
description:
My name is Egle. I am passionate about UI/UX design and data analysis.
In 2019, I graduated university of Southampton with a 1st class Masters degree in Computer Science.
I have experience in programming and front-end development.

shortDescriptions.title: Hobbies
shortDescriptions.description: table tennis, arts & crafts, event organisation, films, PC gaming

shortDescriptions.title: Experience
shortDescriptions.description: Alongside my individual and university projects, I also have experience in a company setting. I worked as a Software Development Intern at Orthoview and as a Service Delivery Intern at Fidessa.

title: Beading
description: When I was in high school I fell in love with beading to the point of obsession. For the next couple of years, it was my main occupation. The projects included little animals, jewelry and bead weaving.
